persister

protected final freenet.node.Persister persister
If true, requests are resumed lazily i.e. startup does not block waiting for them.

clientDatabaseExecutor

public final transient PrioritizedSerialExecutor clientDatabaseExecutor
All client-layer database access occurs on a SerialExecutor, so that we don't need to have multiple parallel transactions. Advantages: - We never have two copies of the same object in RAM, and more broadly, we don't need to worry about interactions between objects from different transactions. - Only one weak-reference cache for the database. - No need to refresh live objects. - Deactivation is simpler. Note that the priorities are thread priorities, not request priorities.

queue

public void queue(DBJob job,
                  int priority,
                  boolean checkDupes)
           throws DatabaseDisabledException
Description copied from interface: DBJobRunner
Queue a database job. This will be run on the database thread, once it comes off the queue.

Specified by:
queue in interface DBJobRunner
Parameters:
job - The job to run.
priority - The priority of the job. This uses NativeThread priorities, but only to determine which job to run first.
checkDupes - If true, check whether there is a job which is equals() to this job which is already queued to run, and if so don't queue the new job.
Throws:
DatabaseDisabledException

queueRestartJob

public void queueRestartJob(DBJob job,
                            int priority,
                            com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                            boolean early)
                     throws DatabaseDisabledException
Queue a job to be run soon after startup. The job must delete itself.

Specified by:
queueRestartJob in interface DBJobRunner
early - If true, the job will be run just after startup, at HIGH priority; the priority given determines the order of such jobs. If false, it will be queued to the database job scheduler at the given priority. Late jobs are responsible for removing themselves!
Throws:
DatabaseDisabledException

public void runBlocking(DBJob job,
                        int priority)
                 throws DatabaseDisabledException
Description copied from interface: DBJobRunner
Run this database job blocking. If we are already on the database thread, run it inline, otherwise schedule it at the specified priority and wait for it to finish.

Specified by:

onIdle

public void onIdle()
Description copied from interface: ExecutorIdleCallback
Called when the executor is idle for some period. On a single-thread executor, this will be called on the thread which runs the jobs, but after that the thread may change.

Specified by:
onIdle in interface ExecutorIdleCallback
